p: The solvent that best extracted the tannins from P. capitata was ethanol ( Figure 4(d)), which exhibited significantly higher extraction capacity than methanol and water. With these three solvents, the rate of tannins decreased significantly during fruiting in all extracts, regardless of the host of P. capitata. With hexane and ethyl acetate, the tannin levels were low and decreased significantly during flowering except when the host was P. mannii, for which these levels remained constant during flowering and during fruiting.
